data.title: What is an Autoencoder?
data.description: An autoencoder is an artificial neural network used to learn data encodings in an unsupervised manner.

data.title: What is Object Tracking in Computer Vision?
data.description: Object tracking is an application of computer vision. The program detects objects and then tracks their movements in space or across frames.

data.title: Top 6 Manufacturing Datasets for Computer Vision
data.description: This post will show you 6 of the best open source datasets for computer vision tasks in the manufacturing industry.

data.title: Accelerate PyTorch Models via OpenVINO™ Integration with Torch-ORT
data.description: Inference on Intel® hardware by integrating OpenVINO™ toolkit with Torch-ORT while maintaining the native PyTorch experience.

data.title: How to Use Computer Vision to Control OBS Studio
data.description: Run a computer vision model in your web browser that controls OBS Studio with objects and gestures.

data.title: Launch: Cloning Images from Open Source Datasets
data.description: Clone any of the 100+ million open source images in Roboflow Universe and add them into your Roboflow account

data.title: Roboflow Joins AWS Global Startup Program and Becomes AWS ISV Accelerate Partner
data.description: Roboflow joins the AWS Global Startup Program and becomes an AWS ISV Accelerate Partner

data.title: Sharing Your Computer Vision Project on Roboflow Universe
data.description: Roboflow Universe is the best place to host your public computer vision datasets and share them with the community for free.

data.title: Semantic Segmentation vs. Instance Segmentation: Explained
data.description: This article explains the two types of segmentations and compares and contrasts possible distinctions between instance and semantic segmentation.

data.title: Launch: Use YouTube Videos for Training Data and Inference Testing
data.description: Roboflow supports using Youtube video links for uploading data and testing model performance in the browser.

data.title: Launch: Smart Polygon Labeling
data.description: Polygon annotations are used for training instance segmentation or semantic segmentation models and can improve model accuracy.

data.title: Object Detection vs. Image Classification vs. Keypoint Detection
data.description: This blog will help you understand object detection, image classification, and keypoint detection.

data.title: Supervised Learning vs. Unsupervised Learning: Explained
data.description: In this blog post, we explain supervised and unsupervised learning and discuss their differences alongside their advantages and drawbacks.

data.title: Measure Distance in Photos and Videos Using Computer Vision
data.description: By the end of this blog post, you will be able to calculate distance between two objects in an image or video.

data.title: How to Train YOLOv5 Instance Segmentation on a Custom Dataset
data.description: This blog will walk through how to train YOLOv5 for instance segmentation on a custom dataset.

data.title: Launch: Test Computer Vision Models Locally
data.description: Learn how to deploy your computer vision model on your development machine with only a few lines of code.

data.title: Using Computer Vision with Drones for Georeferencing
data.description: Learn how to train a computer vision model to detect objects and combine with a video from a drone to plot object detections on a map

data.title: Roboflow Changelog: July & August 2022
data.description: Each month, we share a recap of product and company updates. In this post, we detail Roboflow's updates from July and August 2022.

data.title: Roboflow now available in the AWS Marketplace
data.description: Roboflow’s computer vision platform is transforming the way businesses use computer vision and can now be purchased through the AWS Marketplace

data.title: How I use Computer Vision and Twilio to Guarantee Availability at Busy Public Tennis Courts
data.description: This guide will show you how to create a computer vision application that detects people playing tennis and sends a text notification.

data.title: Train Activity Recognition Models Using Spectrograms and Computer Vision
data.authors: Mohamed Traore, Jeremy Park, Sanjana Banerjee
data.description: As Ph.D. students in the Active Robotics Sensing Lab (ARoS) at NC State under the supervision of Dr. Edgar Lobaton, we developed in conjunction with The Engineering Place at NC State a set of activities to walk high school students through the entire computer vision pipeline.

data.title: WTF COCO - The Weird Images that Underpin Modern Computer Vision Models
data.description: Do you know what is inside the COCO dataset? This post helps you query COCO directly, no login or understanding of computer vision required.

data.title: How to Train YOLOv5-Classification on a Custom Dataset
data.description: This blog will walk through how to train YOLOv5 for Classification on a custom dataset.

data.title: How to Use S3 in Your Computer Vision Pipeline
data.description: In this blog, we will show you how to use AWS S3  in conjunction with Roboflow to store and share your image data across platforms.

data.title: Launch: Dataset Search
data.description: Roboflow has been used to manage and label 90k datasets containing 66 million images and now you can use text search to understand those datasets

data.title: Building Custom Computer Vision Models with NVIDIA TAO Toolkit and Roboflow
data.description: NVIDIA's TAO Toolkit provides a framework for fine-tuning popular computer vision models using your own data. In this tutorial, we'll be demonstrating how to use Roboflow to curate a high-quality computer vision dataset to use with NVIDIA's TAO Toolkit.

data.title: Using Object Detection to Trigger Automated Email Alerts
data.description: In this tutorial, we'll show you how to use object detection to identify specific configurations within an image to trigger email notifications

data.title: Launch: Deploy Computer Vision Models to a Raspberry Pi
data.description: Roboflow supports deploying to Raspberry Pi via our Inference Server for computer vision tasks like object detection.

data.title: Develop like a Pro with NVIDIA + Docker + VS Code + PyTorch
data.description: See how to install NVIDIA drivers, docker & nvidia docker, run gpu accelerated containers with PyTorch, develop with VSCode within the container

data.title: Use Raspberry Pi and Luxonis OAK to Deploy Vision Models in Robotics
data.description: With Roboflow and Luxonis OAK, you can develop and run powerful computer vision models on your robots.
